docs.lead_paragraph: American politicians say some outrageous things about rape. But our policies toward rape victims can be even more insensitive.

headline.main: Want a Real Reason to Be Outraged?
headline.print_headline: Want a Real Reason to Be Outraged?

docs.abstract: Nicholas D Kristof Op-Ed column laments that political system becomes incensed over stupid comments about rape and abortion, yet stupid policies are largely ignored; underlines ways in which sexual assault is met with lackadaisical attitude in country; calls for concerted push to address policy failures on issue, starting with more testing of rape kits.
docs.snippet: American politicians say some outrageous things about rape. But our policies toward rape victims can be even more insensitive.

docs.lead_paragraph: If you respect the sanctity of life, then it shouldn’t be limited solely to the issue of abortion.
docs.abstract: Thomas L Friedman Op-Ed column expresses concern about statements made by Republican elected officials concerning abortion, which illustrate way in which ever-more-assertive far-right base is intent on pushing party to uncompromising position on issue; contends that their characterization of themselves as being pro-life distorts the issue, and underlines hypocrisy of description being applied to party that adamantly opposes gun control.
docs.snippet: If you respect the sanctity of life, then it shouldn’t be limited solely to the issue of abortion.

headline.main: Missouri Senate Poll Shows McCaskill's Lead Narrowing

docs.abstract: The Missouri Senate race has narrowed to a dead heat, according to a new poll released on Saturday, a drastic turnaround since Representative Todd Akin, the Republican challenging incumbent Senator Claire McCaskill, upended the race with controversial comments about rape two months ago.
docs.snippet: The Missouri Senate race has narrowed to a dead heat, according to a new poll released on Saturday, a drastic turnaround since Representative Todd Akin, the Republican challenging incumbent Senator Claire McCaskill, upended the race with...

docs.lead_paragraph: Alexander Sanger, chairman of the International Planned Parenthood Council, responds to a news article.
docs.snippet: Alexander Sanger, chairman of the International Planned Parenthood Council, responds to a news article.

docs.lead_paragraph: Another debate between U.S. Senate candidates this week has made rape and abortion the political topics of the moment.

headline.seo: Talk About a Way With Words
headline.main: Talk About a Way With Words
headline.print_headline: Talk About A Way With Words

docs.abstract: Gail Collins Op-Ed column puts spotlight on Richard Mourdock, Republican candidate for Indiana's State Senate, who caused  national stir when he said pregnancy caused by rape ‘is something that God intended to happen;’ says anti-abortion comments made by him and Todd Akin reveal extreme starkness of Republicans' anti-choice stance that sounds so unthreatening when they simply say that they are pro-life.
docs.snippet: Another debate between U.S. Senate candidates this week has made rape and abortion the political topics of the moment.

headline.main: Mourdock and Ryan, Abortion and Rape

docs.abstract: Richard Mourdock's recent comments on rape and abortion help explain why we should ask candidates tough questions about faith.
docs.snippet: Richard Mourdock's recent comments on rape and abortion help explain why we should ask candidates tough questions about faith.

docs.lead_paragraph: A psychoanalyst discusses the emotional choices involved.

headline.print_headline: Freezing Her Eggs: A Woman’s Choices

docs.lead_paragraph: A reader decries two candidates’ statements opposing abortions even for rape victims.
docs.snippet: A reader decries two candidates’ statements opposing abortions even for rape victims.

headline.main: Obama Arrives in Florida, Heads to Krispy Kreme, Before First Rally of the Day

docs.abstract: A hoarse and sleep-deprived President Obama arrived in Tampa, Fla., on Thursday morning after an all-night, cross-country flight as he blitzed swing states in a round-the-clock effort to reverse his opponent's momentum.
docs.snippet: A hoarse and sleep-deprived President Obama arrived in Tampa, Fla., on Thursday morning after an all-night, cross-country flight as he blitzed swing states in a round-the-clock effort to reverse his opponent's momentum.

docs.lead_paragraph: An argument against abortion when pregnancy resulted from rape because all life is sacred led to calls that Richard E. Mourdock of Indiana is out of step with women.

headline.seo: Using Mourdock’s Rape Comment Against Romney
headline.main: Rape Remark Jolts a Senate Race, and the Presidential One, Too
headline.print_headline: Rape Remark Jolts a Senate Race, and the Presidential One, Too

docs.abstract: Incendiary comments regarding abortion and rape by Indiana Senate candidate Richard E Mourdock creates difficulty for Mitt Romney, who endorsed him only days before; Romney, reaching out to women voters, has been trying to distance himself from the most uncompromising positions of many Republicans on abortion.
docs.snippet: An argument against abortion when pregnancy resulted from rape because all life is sacred led to calls that Richard E. Mourdock of Indiana is out of step with women.
